alert.note: Alert for Clackamas; Columbia; Multnomah; Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued October 17 at 11:20AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THURSDAY... Southwest Clean Air Agency and the Oregon Department of Environmental Quality have continued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 6 PM PDT Thursday. A Smoke Air Quality Advisory remains in effect. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels at times through Thursday. Will see improving air quality Thursday night into the weekend, as weather fronts will bring west to southwest winds, and rain as early as Friday evening. Pollutants in smoke can cause burning eyes, runny nose, aggravate heart and lung diseases, and aggravate other serious health problems. Limit outdoor activities and keep children indoors if it is smoky. Please follow medical advice if you have a heart or lung condition. More information about air quality can be found at: www.swcleanair.gov www.oregon.gov/DEQ
